content.question:
Researchers analyzed the composition of cell membranes of bacteria living in different environments. Thermophiles are bacteria that live at extremely high temperatures, typically at or above \(\text{70}{}^\circ \text{C}\).Â 

Which of the following best predicts the effect of a greater proportion of saturated fatty acids, as compared with unsaturated fatty acids, on the stability of the cell membrane in thermophiles?

choices.label: A greater proportion of saturated fatty acids has no effect on cell membrane stability because both saturated and unsaturated fatty acids are hydrophobic.
A greater proportion of saturated fatty acids leads to increased membrane stability at lower temperatures because saturated fatty acids increase the stability of the membrane.
A greater proportion of saturated fatty acids leads to decreased membrane stability because saturated fatty acids decrease the fluidity of the membrane.
A greater proportion of saturated fatty acids leads to increased membrane stability at higher temperatures because saturated fatty acids pack tightly together.

content.answer: A greater proportion of saturated fatty acids leads to increased membrane stability at higher temperatures because saturated fatty acids pack tightly together.
